data.title: Alien Roll is a Must
data.text: My husband and I had 2 rolls. The Alien Roll was delicious. Also, Japanese beer, Asahi- you've got to try it!

data.title: Out with friends
data.text: Very busy the night we arrived.  First time there. Food and wine were excellent.  It is a pricey and tables are small and cramped.

data.title: Still Great
data.text: We dined at this restaurant a year ago.  We were in Norman this month and remembered how good it was and decided to eat here again. It didn't disappoint.  They service was super friendly and the fish ultra fresh.  They have a somewhat limited menu, but everything is outstanding. A great find in Norman.

data.title: Love This Place
data.text:
Whenever I come to Norman I try to eat here. They have reasonably priced alcohol (total score) abs amazing sushi. WARNING: Cherry Death Sauce should be on the side. Make adjustments, they tend to be spicy-hot, but with an amazing twist. I come here as often as I can and love it.

The calamari is in the Asian style and is wonderful.

data.title: Favorite Sushi place in Norman
data.text: When we want Sushi in Norman this is our #1 spot.  We tend to get the Hawaiian tuna or salmon special when available.  We almost always get the Pscha D, Cruchy Ghost and Devil's Advocate.

data.title: Hawaiian Heaven
data.text: Celebrating selling our out of state condo & we picked the right place. I had the Hawaii sashimi special and it was EXQUISITE. Fresh and creamy marlin, tuna & salmon. Fantastic. Partner had steak- he really enjoyed it. Crab cake appetizer was a 10. Ice cream dessert is made by Grant in the kitchen. He doesn't spare premium ingredients. Devin gave us the tour of the menu and following his recommendations was wise and enjoyable. We'll be back soon!

data.title: Wow!!!
data.text: My wife and I ate here tonite and were blown away by the rolls created by the sushi masters. The staff is very knowledgable about the menu and can steer you in the right direction. We had the crunchy ghost, el diablo, and the meek monster and loved all three. We cannot wait to return. Thanks Lauren!

data.title: YUM YUM YUM
data.text: We chose to sit at the sushi bar & it was interesting to watch the guys create the different rolls. Our favorite roll was the Meek Monster......DELICIOUS!!!! I felt they were priced reasonably and this is a good place to bring the whole family.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: I have only made it to eat there one time, but my experience was a good one. The server lady I had was VERY nice and helpful with the menu. She suggested the crab cakes, and a sushi roll with the must have "cherry bomb" sauce. SO GOOD! Much MUCH better than O-Asian. The only downfall is the location, if you don't know where it is, it is very easy to pass up.

data.title: Favorite Sushi in Norman
data.text:
This sushi restaurant had a unique perspective. They love it hot. Caliente. Okay, wrong language but who cares?

They have awesome art, some of which is actually for sale. 

They bring out free edamame so save your pennies and don't order it.

They have generous wine pores so watch yourself. 

First of all, I love their calamari. It's in the Asian style, long, thick pieces of calamari, not the wimpy rings. Love it. 

Their spicy mayo had a bite of wasabi or horseradish. So yum. But be forewarned. 

I ordered a roll with jalapeños, Sriracha, and cherry death sauce. I had the cherry death sauce on the side, which was a good choice. Otherwise, it could have been death in the library by the Colonel with cherry death sauce.

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text: This is a great place to eat.  The sushi was delicious, the atmosphere was fun, and the service was incredible.  The restaurant is very popular, especially on Friday nights, so plan to arrive early, or visit on a different night.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I go in often and when I do I sit at the bar were I can visibly see them making perfect and delicious sushi. Prices are good, friendly staff and great management. I recommend this place if you want quality sushi

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Hard to find at night if unfamiliar with area. Service was excellent. Food was okay. Calamari appetizer was not like any I have seen, not cut in rings but a thick long tube. Edamame was brought to table, complementary. Tuna nigiri was good. Seared tuna tool good. Large selection of house special rolls. Scallop dinner was just okay. Risotto appeared to be just a fried rice. Average dinner/average prices.

data.title: Progressive entrée
data.text: So on this year's progressive dinner for entrée we tried Full Moon Sushi, not being big "sushitarians" I thought "this will be different", and indeed it was. It was fun, the staff was friendly, and helpful. My wife not being a seafood lover at all, ordered the thunder roll. Surprisingly the steak flavor was great in a roll. I got the "zombie", the crab meat was flavorful and mixed well with the the salmon. Next up, was the full moon, which had a great mix of crunchy calamari and smokey salmon. Finally the meek monster filled with a wonderful mix cream cheese and avocado mixed with shrimp. If you like seafood, primarily sushi, this is a good casual place to go.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: By far the best Sushi in Norman! Great service by friendly and knowledge staff, great selection, and fresh ingredients !!

data.title: The BEST coach in Norman
data.text: If Lon Kruger and Bob Stoops had similar abilities to Lauren (our hostess who led us blindly through the specials and the menu) at guiding a team, OU would have perfect basketball and football seasons.  We purchased OU season basketball tickets for the first time after having football season tickets for over forty years.  We decided that we would precede each game with a culinary event in Norman before traveling to the game.  Our first choice was Full Moon Sushi.  Lauren greeted and introduced herself with justifiable enthusiasm.  She related that there were several specials that she was appropriately excited about relating, and would we like for her to be our culinary guide...we said "yes".  Our special of the day appetizer was a seemingly mundane pot stickers (while, we waited for the dish to be served, my wife, who loves edamame...I fail to share her love... was consumed) was brilliantly prepared by Grant.  Lovely, lovely, and did I say lovely!  A special of the day pumpkin and jalapeno soup followed that made you wish that you had licked the bowl.  Both dishes were chosen  by Lauren without our knowledge.  We informed Lauren that we appreciated extremely spicy dishes, and she provided a sushi that was beyond compare prepared by Doug.  The blinded dessert was a jalapeno cream brulee.  It was absolutely an exquisite way to conclude a fabulous mean accompanied by a dry premium sake.  And...we won the basketball game that followed.

data.title: yummy sushi
data.text: Love this place. Thomas Kuhns is the best sushi master! The food is always good and the service is excellent!

data.title: Wonderful and varied
data.text:
This restaurant has some of the best sushi anywhere in the OKC area. It is always
fresh and inventive. They have a very wide assortment of rolls. In addition for those
folks who do not like sushi, they have other dishes like steak and pork. The restaurant has a nice ambiance and serves a vary wide-ranging clientele : they are young couples,
older couples, folks with children, etc. This is a downtown Norman restaurant and sometimes you have to look around to find a nearby parking place, but it is well worth the visit. The prices are reasonable and they have a good selection of beers and wines and saki.

data.title: GRRRR-REAT!
data.text:
I liked this restaurant so much, I ate here two days in a row. Their Gyoza are chicken and excellent. Their rolls are imaginative and tummy. The Calamari is in the far eastern style and wonderful. 

Their wine list is not extensive but is well-appointed. This place is a win.

Oh, and service is great: ask for Tyler.

data.title: Love the sushi!
data.text: The atmosphere is good. Wonderful place to meet friends. Staff always welcoming and helpful. The sushi is wonderful! My husband likes the other food, since he is not a sushi eater.
